item.text: Became Public Law No: 108-431.
Became Public Law No: 108-431.
Signed by President.

Presented to President.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S11566-11584; text as passed Senate: CR S11566)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S11566-11584; text as passed Senate: CR S11566)
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 697.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Campbell without amendment. With written report No. 108-343.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Campbell without amendment. With written report No. 108-343.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H3562)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H3562)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2912.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H3562-3563)
Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 286.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-502.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-502.
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Hearings Held.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Introduced in House
Introduced in House

item.title: H.R. 2912, A bill to reaffirm the inherent sovereign rights of the Osage Tribe to determine its membership and form of government
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Resources on May 5, 2004

item.title: H.R. 2912, An act to reaffirm the inherent sovereign rights of the Osage Tribe to determine its membership and form of government
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs on July 14, 2004

item.title: H.R. 2912, An act to reaffirm the inherent sovereign rights of the Osage Tribe to determine its membership and form of government
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs on July 14, 2004

summary.text:
Declares the term " legal membership" in the Osage Allotment Act of June 28, 1906 means the persons eligible for allotments of Osage Reservation lands and a pro rata share of the Osage mineral estate in Pawhuska, Oklahoma, as provided in such Act, not membership in the Osage Tribe, for all purposes.

Reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Tribe to determine its own: (1) membership, provided that the rights of any person to Osage mineral estate shares are not diminished; and (2) form of government.

Requires the Secretary of the Interior, at the request of the Tribe, to provide assistance in conducting elections and referenda to implement this Act.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
